job_purpose: Provide end-to-end data science services across energy production assets to inform asset performance monitoring, investment decisions, market analysis, and financial forecasting.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Analyzing and reporting on renewable energy asset performance
Designing and implementing data models for performance monitoring
Maintaining market data for analysis and modeling
Reporting asset performance results to key stakeholders
Analyzing energy market and commodity price information
Supporting new investment and M&A activities with data insights
required_qualifications: Minimum of 5 years’ experience in data analysis
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or related field
Advanced analytical skills with large data volumes
Experience in building and maintaining data models for asset management and investment decisions
Proficiency in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Excel
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work autonomously with a go-getter attitude
Sense of urgency and high level of commercial acumen
preferred_qualifications: Knowledge of renewable energy generation and electricity markets in Australia
MBA, Master of Data Science, or secondary qualifications in Engineering
Experience in energy and commodity markets analysis
Experience in M&A and investment analysis
company_details: Leading boutique human resources agency specializing in white collar recruitment and HR consulting within mining & resources, engineering, HR, and business support. Client is a long-established energy business with significant operations in Australia and the UK, owning and managing renewable energy assets.
